mods.abstract: This Indian mound was constructed around AD 1000. It is 7 feet tall with a square-shaped base. It was once part of a larger complex made up of five mounds. The oak tree on the northwest corner of the mound is thought to mark the grave of Houma Courtea alias Touh-la-bayne of the Biloxi nation who owned this property between 1822-1844. The historic Picou Cemetery on top dates from 1901-1990s.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection
